alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Pointe Coupee; Southeast St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 2:47PM CDT until August 22 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS IN SOUTH MISSISSIPPI AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA... .In coordination with state and federal fire weather officials, along with the combination of the moderate to severe drought across the area, extreme temperatures, minimum rh values below 35%, and area wide burn bans, critical fire weather conditions are expected to continue through Tuesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR CIRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR SOUTH AND COASTAL MISSISSIPPI AND POTIONS OF SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREA...Pointe Coupee, West Feliciana, East Feliciana, St. Helena, Washington, West Baton Rouge, East Baton Rouge, Wilkinson, Amite, Pike, Northern Tangipahoa, Walthall, Southeast St. Tammany, Pearl River, Northern St. Tammany, Southwestern St. Tammany, Hancock, Central Tangipahoa, Harrison, Lower Tangipahoa, Jackson, Northern Livingston and Southern Livingston. * WINDS...East 5 to 12 mph on Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 33 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. A Burn Ban is already in place for all areas.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
